results.title: 6 Sentenced to Death in Bangladesh for Killing of Gay Rights Activist
results.abstract: The activist Xulhaz Mannan, who had started a gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender magazine, was hacked to death in a machete attack in 2016.

results.title: Inside Kabul airport, the last American soldier leaves, and the first Taliban fighters arrive.
results.abstract: Two images marked the end of the nearly 20-year war: a U.S. soldier leaving Kabul’s airport, and Taliban fighters nearby walking in.

results.title: Human Most of All: In Moscow, a Theater Stages ‘Gorbachev’
results.abstract: The Latvian director Alvis Hermanis’s bioplay is an ode to the love story of Mikhail and Raisa Gorbachev, and portrays the former leader in all his humanity.

multimedia.caption: Yevgeny Mironov as Mikhail Gorbachev and Chulpan Khamatova, as his wife, Raisa, in “Gorbachev” at Theater of Nations in Moscow.
multimedia.copyright: Ira Polyarnaya, via Theater of Nations, Moscow

results.title: Band of Robbers Tie Hostages to Cars in Brazilian City
results.abstract: The assault was the latest launched by well-trained and heavily-armed bands on robbers targeting small cities at night.

results.title: Unvaccinated U.S. visitors could soon face new restrictions on travel to Europe.
results.abstract: The European Union’s leaders removed the United States from a “safe list.” Individual countries in the bloc are not obliged to follow suit, however.
